item.title: Neil Gorsuch has Elena Kagan dead to rights
item.description: Democratic-appointed Supreme Court justices suddenly discover the merit of limiting the executive.

item.title: Plácido Domingo: The truth about my time at the Washington National Opera
item.description: Post readers on the WNO, Southwest price changes, Zohran Mamdani and more.

item.title: Fixing America’s broken nuclear fuel supply
item.description: Growth and AI advances can’t come without big leaps in energy production.

item.title: A new reminder of America’s debt problem
item.description: The CBO’s latest report predicts the budget deficit will increase by a trillion dollars over the next decade.

item.title: I plan to donate my organs — but I’ve taken my name off the registry
item.description: As an ICU nurse, I’ve seen organ donation rules hurt families. Here’s a workaround.

item.title: Why our brains can’t handle a modern economy
item.description: Insurance premiums and $50K SUVs blind Americans to the illnesses and accidents that never happen.

item.title: Stand back, Congress needs a second Supreme Court jolt
item.description: The justices’ ruling on tariffs blocked Trump but insufficiently addressed executive branch overreach.

item.title: South Africa’s ANC takes a free-market turn
item.description: After years of rolling blackouts, South Africa finally got the lights back on, after the free market-averse ANC decided to take a chance on private enterprise.

item.title: The unlucky truth about love
item.description: Governments are trying and failing to increase birth rates.

item.title: Progressives for news media regulation
item.description: New York legislation would tell publishers how they can and can’t use artificial intelligence.
